page.title: 02COTTON FARM
page.content: The owner of Cotton Farm has 120 acres of land,some of it is for grazing,some for silage,turnips or maize.The barns are built of stone,slate and wood.1840 was marked on a stone in the barn where cows and chickens were kept. We saw a litter of 18 piglets that were 3 weeks old,usually 14 is a good size litter.The farmer has 70 cows,the milking parlour was built in 1980 and the cows are milked here at 6a.m.and 5p.m.daily.Each winter a cow eats 50-60 tons of silage.All the local farms are built near streams,the water is pumped to 2 large tanks,and each cow drinks 20-30 gallons per day.Most machinery belongs to the farmer,but he does hire and share some.He gets some one to cut his hedges,he has one other worker on the farm.
